[xref]a[/xref]Great is Jehovah, and much to be praised; / And His greatness is unsearchable.
One generation will laud Your works to another, / And they will declare Your mighty acts.
Upon the glorious splendor of Your majesty / And upon Your wondrous works I will muse.
And men will speak of the might of Your awesome deeds, / And I will declare Your greatness.
They will utter the memory of Your great goodness / And will sing for joy of Your righteousness.
[xref]a[/xref]Jehovah is gracious and compassionate, / Long-suffering and great in lovingkindness.
Jehovah is good to all, / And His compassions are upon all His works.
All Your works will praise You, O Jehovah; / And Your faithful ones will bless You.
They will speak of the glory of Your kingdom / And tell of Your power,
To make known to the sons of men [note]1[/note]Your mighty acts / And the glorious splendor of [note]1[/note]Your kingdom.
verse.note: Lit., His (twice).

verse.text: Your kingdom is an [xref]a[/xref]eternal kingdom, / And Your dominion is throughout all generations.
Jehovah upholds all who are falling / And raises up all who are bowed down.
The eyes of everyone wait for You, / And You give them their [xref]a[/xref]food in due season.
You open up Your hand / And satisfy the desire of every living thing.
Jehovah is [xref]a[/xref]righteous in all His ways, / And faithfully kind in all His doings.
Jehovah is [xref]a[/xref]near to all who [xref]b[/xref]call upon Him, / To all who call upon Him in truth.
He will fulfill the desire of those who fear Him, / And He will hear their cry and save them.
Jehovah preserves all who love Him, / But He will [note]1[/note]destroy all the wicked.
verse.note: See note [link]7[sup]1[/sup] in Psa. 3[/link].

verse.text: My mouth will speak the praise of Jehovah, / And all flesh will bless His holy name forever and ever.
[note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Hallelujah! / Praise Jehovah, O my soul!
verse.note: See note [link]35[sup]1[/sup] in Psa. 104[/link]. [link]Psalms 146-150[/link] each begin and end with the word [i]Hallelujah.[/i] These five psalms may be considered the consummate praises, corresponding with the praises at the end of Revelation ([link]Rev. 19:1-6[/link]). [link]Psalm 146[/link] concerns the praising of Jehovah for His reigning from Zion ([link]v. 10[/link]).[br][br]In the Septuagint there are superscriptions which indicate that [link]Psa. 146-148[/link] were written by Haggai and Zechariah. This would have been after their return from captivity. The return of God's people from captivity was a great release and restoration (see [link]Ezra[/link] and [link]Nehemiah[/link]).

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]I will praise Jehovah while I live; / I will sing psalms to my God while I yet have being.
Do not trust in [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]princes, / In a son of man, with whom there is no salvation.
verse.note: [link]Verses 3-4[/link] give the background of this psalm. Haggai and Zechariah, who were born in captivity, saw the kings of Babylon and Persia. This was why they said that we should not trust in princes.

verse.text: His breath goes forth; he returns to his earth; / On that day his plans perish.
Blessed is the man whose [xref]a[/xref]help is the God of Jacob, / Whose hope is in Jehovah his God,
Who [xref]a[/xref]made heaven and earth / [i]And[/i] the sea, and all that is in them; / Who keeps faith forever;
Who executes judgment for the oppressed; / Who gives food to the famished. / Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]frees the prisoners;
Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]opens [i]the eyes of[/i] the blind; / Jehovah raises up those who are bowed down; / Jehovah loves the righteous;
Jehovah preserves the sojourners; / He upholds the orphan and the widow; / But He subverts the way of the wicked.
Jehovah will [xref]a[/xref]reign forever, / Your God, O Zion, [note]1[/note]forever and ever. / Hallelujah!
verse.note: Lit., from generation to generation.

verse.text: [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Hallelujah! / For it is good to sing psalms to our God; / For it is pleasant; praise is fitting.
verse.note: See notes [link]35[sup]1[/sup] in Psa. 104[/link] and [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in Psa. 146[/link].

verse.text: Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]builds up Jerusalem; / He [xref]b[/xref]gathers the [note]1[/note]outcasts of Israel.
verse.note: [link]Psalm 147[/link] is a praise to Jehovah for the rebuilding of Jerusalem. The gathering of the outcasts is the release of the captives to bring them back to Jerusalem for the rebuilding of Jerusalem.

verse.text: He heals the [xref]a[/xref]brokenhearted / And binds up their wounds.
He counts the number of the [xref]a[/xref]stars; / He calls them all by [i]their[/i] names.
[xref]a[/xref]Great is our Lord, and mighty in power; / His understanding is infinite.
Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]uplifts the lowly; / He brings the [note]1[/note]wicked down to the ground.
verse.note: The Babylonians and Persians as the captors of the outcasts ([link]v. 2[/link]).

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Sing unto Jehovah with thanksgiving; / Sing psalms to our God with the lyre;
Who covers the heavens with clouds, / Who prepares rain for the earth, / Who causes grass to grow on the mountains,
Who gives to the beast its food, / [i]And[/i] to the young [xref]a[/xref]ravens who cry.
He takes no delight in the strength of horses; / Nor pleasure in the legs of man.
Jehovah takes pleasure in those who fear Him, / In those who hope in His lovingkindness.
[xref]a[/xref]Laud Jehovah, O Jerusalem; / Praise your God, O Zion;
For He has strengthened the bars of your gates; / He has blessed your children within you.
He makes peace in your borders; / He satisfies you with the finest wheat.
He sends forth His command to the earth; / His word [xref]a[/xref]runs very swiftly.
He gives snow like wool; / He scatters frost like ashes;
He casts His hail like crumbs — / Who can stand before His cold?
He sends forth His word and melts them; / He causes His wind to blow; the waters flow.
He [xref]a[/xref]declares His word to Jacob, / His statutes and His ordinances to Israel.
He has not dealt so with any [i]other[/i] nation; / And as for His ordinances, they have not known them. / Hallelujah!
[note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Hallelujah! / Praise Jehovah from the heavens; / Praise Him in the [xref]b[/xref]heights.
verse.note: See note [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in Psa. 146[/link]. [link]Psalm 148[/link] is a praise to Jehovah for His exalted name and for His transcending majesty ([link]v. 13[/link]).

verse.text: Praise Him, all His [xref]a[/xref]angels; / Praise Him, all His hosts.
Praise Him, [xref]a[/xref]sun and moon; / Praise Him, all stars of light.
Praise Him, you [xref]a[/xref]heaven of heavens, / And you [xref]b[/xref]waters that are above the heavens.
Let them praise the name of Jehovah; / For He [xref]a[/xref]commanded, and they were created.
And He established them forever and ever; / He gave the decree which shall not pass away.
Praise Jehovah from the earth, / You [xref]a[/xref]sea monsters and all the depths;
Fire and hail, snow and smoke; / Stormy wind that executes His word;
Mountains and all hills; / Fruit trees and all cedars;
Animals wild and tame; / Creeping things and birds of flight;
Kings of the earth and all peoples; / Princes and all judges of the earth;
Choice young men as well as virgins; / Old men with young men.
Let them praise the name of Jehovah, / For His name alone is exalted; / His glory is above the earth and the heavens.
And He has raised up a [xref]a[/xref]horn for His people, / The praise of all His faithful ones, / The children of Israel, a people [xref]b[/xref]near to Him. / Hallelujah!
[note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Hallelujah! / Sing a [xref]b[/xref]new song to Jehovah; / [i]Sing[/i] His praise in the congregation of [i]His[/i] faithful ones.
verse.note: See note [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in Psa. 146[/link]. [link]Psalm 149[/link] is a praise to Jehovah for His taking pleasure in His people, Israel, and His adorning of the lowly with salvation ([link]v. 4[/link]).

verse.text: Let Israel rejoice in his Maker; / Let the children of [xref]a[/xref]Zion exult in their [xref]b[/xref]King.
Let them praise His name with dancing; / Let them sing psalms to Him with the tambourine and the lyre.
For Jehovah takes pleasure in His people; / He [xref]a[/xref]adorns the lowly with salvation.
Let the faithful ones exult in glory; / Let them give a ringing shout upon their beds.
Let the high praises of God be in their throats, / And a two-edged sword in their hand,
To execute vengeance on the nations / [i]And[/i] punishment among the peoples;
To bind their kings with fetters / And their nobles with chains of iron;
To execute upon them the judgment written. / This honor is for all His faithful ones. / Hallelujah!
[note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Hallelujah! / Praise God in His [xref]b[/xref]sanctuary; / Praise Him in the expanse that [i]manifests[/i] His power.
verse.note: See note [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in Psa. 146[/link]. [link]Psalm 150[/link] is a concluding charge to everything that has breath ([link]v. 6[/link]) to praise God.

verse.text: Praise Him for His mighty acts; / Praise Him according to His vast greatness.
Praise Him with the blast of the trumpet; / Praise Him with the harp and lyre;
Praise Him with the tambourine and with dancing; / Praise Him with the stringed instrument and the pipe.
Praise Him with the loud cymbals; / Praise Him with the loud clanging cymbals.
Let [xref]a[/xref]everything that has breath praise [note]1[/note]Jehovah. / Hallelujah!
verse.note: Heb. [i]Jah,[/i] a shortened form of [i]Jehovah.[/i]
